articles.headline: Heir Apparent at Pimco to Step Down
articles.snippet: Mohamed El-Erian is unexpectedly resigning from the giant asset manager Pimco, dashing expectations that he would take over management of the firm.
articles.abstract: Mohamed El-Erian is unexpectedly resigning from the giant asset manager Pimco, dashing expectations that he would take over management of the firm.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:36 p.m. | The giant asset manager Pimco lost its heir apparent and most prominent spokesman on Tuesday when Mohamed A. El-Erian unexpectedly announced that he was stepping down from the company.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: Recession’s True Cost Is Still Being Tallied
articles.snippet: Last year, the Government Accountability Office estimated that the price tag could range from a few trillion dollars to over $10 trillion.
articles.abstract: Last year, the Government Accountability Office estimated that the price tag could range from a few trillion dollars to over $10 trillion.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Sept. 15, 2008, the investment bank Lehman Brothers collapsed after a long struggle to avoid bankruptcy, paralyzing the world’s financial networks and tipping the United States economy into an abyss from which it has not yet fully emerged.

articles.headline: American Starts a Luxury Resort to Share the Argentina He Loves
articles.snippet: Michael Evans came to Argentina on vacation and stayed, leaving his career as a political consultant to go into the vineyard business.
articles.abstract: Michael Evans came to Argentina on vacation and stayed, leaving his career as a political consultant to go into the vineyard business.
articles.lead_paragraph: VISTA FLORES, Argentina — It is hard to find fault with lunch at Siete Fuegos, the restaurant at the new Vines Resort & Spa in the Mendoza province. The steak is grilled to medium-rare perfection. The sparkling torrontés wine nicely complements the homemade dulce de leche ice cream. The open-air dining room looks upon acres of vineyards set against the snow-capped Andes.

articles.headline: 2 Friends Reach Across the Aisle on Immigration
articles.snippet: If there is any way to unlock the immigration stalemate in Washington, colleagues say that Esther Olavarria, a Democrat, and Rebecca Tallent, a Republican, might find it.
articles.abstract: If there is any way to unlock the immigration stalemate in Washington, colleagues say that Esther Olavarria, a Democrat, and Rebecca Tallent, a Republican, might find it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The two women might at first seem more like political rivals than a reminder of the way things used to work in Washington.

articles.headline: States Cutting Weeks of Aid to the Jobless
articles.snippet: The rest of the country is following North Carolina’s lead by sharply cutting the maximum number of weeks of unemployment benefits available, transforming the country’s safety net for jobless workers.
articles.abstract: The rest of the country is following North Carolina’s lead by sharply cutting the maximum number of weeks of unemployment benefits available, transforming the country’s safety net for jobless workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIEGELWOOD, N.C. — After losing her job as a security guard in June, Alnetta McKnight turned to food stamps and unemployment insurance to support herself and her 14-year-old son. But her jobless payments ran out after 20 weeks, and now they are living on close to nothing.

articles.headline: Investors Seek Yields in Europe, but Analysts Warn of Risk
articles.snippet: Investors are piling into the government debt of bailed-out countries like Ireland. But the demand comes despite the problems still plaguing the euro zone.
articles.abstract: Investors are piling into the government debt of bailed-out countries like Ireland. But the demand comes despite the problems still plaguing the euro zone.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — When Ireland recently made its first offering of new debt since leaving its bailout program, the Irish prime minister, Enda Kenny, was already focused on where the money would come from next.

articles.headline: Banks Take On European Debt, Despite Underlying Problems
articles.snippet: Reassured by austerity programs, investors are again loading up on European sovereign debt, despite deep recessions across Southern Europe.
articles.abstract: Reassured by austerity programs, investors are again loading up on European sovereign debt, despite deep recessions across Southern Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — A wave of euphoria has swept over financial markets because investors now think Europe’s sovereign debt crisis may be ending. But the enthusiasm masks a lingering problem. The harsh austerity programs used to regain their confidence have fanned deep recessions and high unemployment across Southern Europe.

articles.headline: $2 Billion Deal in Works for Puerto Rico
articles.snippet: Puerto Rico is battling a financial crisis that includes high unemployment and a crushing debt load.
articles.abstract: Puerto Rico is battling a financial crisis that includes high unemployment and a crushing debt load.
articles.lead_paragraph: Puerto Rico, which is battling a financial crisis of high unemployment and a crushing debt load, is under pressure to show investors and credit-rating agencies that it can still borrow money from the capital markets.

articles.headline: A Movie Date, a Text Message and a Fatal Shot
articles.snippet: An argument over movie theater etiquette between two Navy veterans led to one man’s death, a charge of murder against the other, Curtis J. Reeves Jr., and a claim of self-defense.
articles.abstract: An argument over movie theater etiquette between two Navy veterans led to one man’s death, a charge of murder against the other, Curtis J. Reeves Jr., and a claim of self-defense.
articles.lead_paragraph: WESLEY CHAPEL, Fla. — There’s a sticker on the door of the Grove 16 Theater just outside Tampa: no weapons.

articles.headline: Photo Archive Is Said to Show Widespread Torture in Syria
articles.snippet: If genuine, the trove is new visual corroboration that Syria’s government is guilty of mass war crimes against its own citizens, just as it appeared to regain some international standing.
articles.abstract: If genuine, the trove is new visual corroboration that Syria’s government is guilty of mass war crimes against its own citizens, just as it appeared to regain some international standing.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Emaciated corpses lie in the sand, their ribs protruding over sunken bellies, their thighs as thin as wrists. Several show signs of strangulation. The images conjure memories of some of history’s worst atrocities.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and David D. Kirkpatrick

articles.headline: Big Web Crash in China: Experts Suspect Great Firewall
articles.snippet: Technology experts say China’s own Great Firewall — the country’s vast collection of censors and snooping technology used to control Internet traffic in and out of China — was most likely to blame for a huge Internet failure, mistakenly redirectin...
articles.abstract: Technology experts say China’s own Great Firewall — the country’s vast collection of censors and snooping technology used to control Internet traffic in and out of China — was most likely to blame for a huge Internet failure, mistakenly redirecting the country’s traffic.

articles.headline: Europe, Facing Economic Pain, May Ease Climate Rules
articles.snippet: The European Union proposed to end binding national targets for renewable energy production, substituting a goal likely to be much harder to enforce.
articles.abstract: The European Union proposed to end binding national targets for renewable energy production, substituting a goal likely to be much harder to enforce.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For years, Europe has tried to set the global standard for climate-change regulation, creating tough rules on emissions, mandating more use of renewable energy sources and arguably sacrificing some economic growth in the name of saving the planet.
